dublin_core.dcvalue: Extracting high quality dynamic foreground layers from a video sequence is a challenging problem due to the coupling of color motion and occlusion Many approaches assume that the background scene is static or undergoes the planar perspective transformation In this paper we relax these restrictions and present a comprehensive system for accurately computing object motion layer and depth information A novel algorithm that combines different clues to extract the foreground layer is proposed where a voting like scheme robust to outliers is employed in optimization The system is capable of handling difficult examples in which the background is nonplanar and the camera freely moves during video capturing Our work finds several applications such as high quality view interpolation and video editing
